definition: (of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)

sentences.english: The wedding expenses in Shanghai are among the highest in the country.
sentences.chinese: 上海的婚嫁消費成本在全國居首位。

sentences.english: VOICE: So they had two sons who survived long enough to get married.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，他們一共有兩個兒子活到了婚嫁年齡。

sentences.english: Material conditions do not drive history.
sentences.chinese: 婚嫁狀況並不能驅動歷史。

sentences.english: Finally unexpectedly claimed in spring, unfavorable oligosaccharides. glucohexaose without marriage.
sentences.chinese: 最後竟聲稱寡年無春，不宜婚嫁。

sentences.english: Perhaps she is on the sunny side of marriage age but I doubt it.
sentences.chinese: 或許她還未到婚嫁年齡，但我懷疑。

sentences.english: These I will wear as a wedding band, a symbol of permanence.
sentences.chinese: 我將披起婚嫁的絲帶，作爲銘刻永恆的標誌。

sentences.english: Maria was so much in love with Jose, and she wanted to marry him.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗亞跟荷西墜入了情網並且論及了婚嫁。

sentences.english: Catholic priests are not allowed to marry.
sentences.chinese: 天主教的教士不準婚嫁。

definition: to take a wife/to get married (man)
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
variant of 訂婚|订婚[ding4 hun1]
to give birth to a child or children
